title: two different problem fonts!
content:
HELP PLZ. too many deadlines ...eyes can't search any more. TWO different font styles for two very different projects

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015143937im_/http:/typophile.com/files/janet%20theory_5400.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015143937im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mackew_6478.jpg)
author: P.I.

comments.content: Thank you so much.... one problem solved. One to go. Someone Please!!!

No match at dafont sci fi for janettheory, but a couple are close.

[http://www.dafont.com/ausprobe.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015143937/http:/www.dafont.com/ausprobe.font "http://www.dafont.com/ausprobe.font")  
 Italic, but remove slant & you are almost there.  
 Galaxy Legion's Font?  
and  
 [http://www.dafont.com/2015-cruiser.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015143937/http:/www.dafont.com/2015-cruiser.font "http://www.dafont.com/2015-cruiser.font")  
 Too narrow  
 Back to the Future II  
I could look further, but you seem to be in a rush :)  
Perhaps someone else has nailed this one.  
Don

Definitely feasible to use ausprobe [provided you solve any copyright issues with the designer] as a basis for editing if you can't find the precise font in janet. Here is a test slanted 24.5% left & horiz comp 80%.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015143937im_/http:/typophile.com/files/janetquicktest_5293.jpg)
  
Don
THANK YOU SOOOOOOOO MUCH. My eyes also thank you. You guys are the BEST!
The font used was Dan Zadorozny's [Dodger](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015143937/http:/www.iconian.com/d.html).

Fits like a glove, well made. It takes time to check the independent font sites.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015143937im_/http:/typophile.com/files/DodgerInUse_6179.jpg)
  
Don

Hah! thanks, Don. Actually, I have the font and it looked familiar. I rather like it better fuzzier with rounded corners as on the cloth.

Hopefully, Patricia returns.
